langsim.utils.plotting module¶

scatter_plot(coords, point_names, title=None, output_path=None, pickle_path=None, additional_plotting=None, point_colors=None)[source]¶

Scatter plot of labelled points. Specify the 2D coordinates of every point and a name to label it with.

Parameters:
  • coords – 2D coordinates of all points. List of pairs
  • point_names – String/unicode name to label each point with. Must contain one per point
  • title – Optional. Plot title
  • output_path – Optional. Filename to output plot to as SVG. If not given, no SVG is output
  • additional_plotting – Optional. Callback to call when plot is ready, before outputting. Takes 3 args: figure, axes, coordinates
  • point_colors – Optional. A colour for each point. List of matplotlib colour specifiers. Should contain one colour per point. If not given, every point is black
  • pickle_path – Optional. Path to pickle the plot to. This allows you to unpickle it later to get an interactive plot using matplotlib.
series_plot(values_lists, series_names, output_path, title=None, fmt='x-')[source]¶
plot_mds(vectors, names, output_path, distance_metric='cosine', **kwargs)[source]¶

Given some vectors, compute multidimensional scaling reduction and plot it in 2D.

Kwargs are passed through to scatter_plot().

Parameters:
  • vectors – Point vectors. The distance will be computed between the vectors for MDS
  • names – Names to label the points with
  • output_path – Path to output plot to.
  • distance_metric – Distance metric to compute distance between the points. Should be one of the following strings: “cosine”, “euclidean”; or a one-arg function that computes the distance matrix between all rows of the point vectors
Returns:

Fitted MDS
